questions.q: What is the purpose of the DNS (Domain Name System) in a network?
o: To map domain names to IP addresses
To encrypt data for secure transmission
To facilitate routing between different networks
questions.e: DNS translates domain names into IP addresses, a fundamental service for network communication.

questions.q: What is the purpose of traffic shaping?
o: to mitigate delays over slow links
to provide fair queuing for buffered flows
to limit the bandwidth that a flow can use to
be a marking mechanism that identifies different flows
questions.e: Traffic shaping retains excess packets in a queue and then schedules the excess for later transmission over increments of time, which effectively provides fair queuing for buffered flows.

questions.q: what occurs to frames during the process of frame flooding?
o: Frames are sent to every port on the switch in the same VLAN except from the originating port
Frames are sent to every port on the switch that has a matching entry in the MAC address table.
Frames are sent to all ports, including those that are assigned to other VLANs.
Frames are sent to every port on the switch in the same VLAN.
questions.e: Frame flooding occurs for broadcast, multicast, or unknown unicast frames, sending them out all ports in the same VLAN except the ingress port.

questions.q: What software defined architecture plane assists network devices with making packet-forwarding decisions by providing Layer 2 reachability and Layer 3 routing information?
questions.e: The **control plane** is responsible for building and maintaining the forwarding tables (MAC address table, routing table) that the data plane uses to make forwarding decisions.

questions.q: Which switch in this configuration will be elected as the root bridge? SW1: 0C:E0:38:00:94:04, SW2: 0C:0E:15:22:05:97, SW3: 0C:0E:15:1A:3C:9D, SW4: 0C:E0:18:A1:B3:19
questions.e: The root bridge is elected based on the lowest Bridge ID (Priority + MAC Address). Assuming default priorities, the switch with the numerically lowest MAC address is chosen. SW2 (0C:0E:15:22:05:97) has the lowest MAC address among the choices.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the ICMP protocol in networking?
o: Troubleshoot and diagnose network connectivity issues
questions.e: ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) is used for network diagnostics and troubleshooting, such as sending error messages and operational information (e.g., the ping utility).

questions.q: Which state does the switch port move to when PortFast is enabled?
questions.e: PortFast causes an STP-enabled port to immediately transition from blocking to the **forwarding** state, skipping the listening and learning states, to minimize connectivity delay for end-user devices.

questions.q: Which device operates at Layer 2 of the OSI model?
questions.e: A **Switch** operates at Layer 2 (Data Link Layer) using MAC addresses for frame forwarding.

questions.q: What must be considered when using 802.11a?
o: It is compatible with 802.11b- and 802.11g-compliant wireless devices
It is used in place of 802.11b/g when many nonoverlapping channels are required
It is susceptible to interference from 2.4 GHz devices such as microwave ovens.
It is chosen over 802.11b/g when a lower-cost solution is necessary
questions.e: 802.11a operates in the 5 GHz band, which provides more non-overlapping channels than the 2.4 GHz band used by 802.11b/g.

questions.q: Which WAN topology provides a combination of simplicity, quality, and availability?
questions.e: A **partial mesh** offers redundancy and availability without the high cost and complexity of a full mesh.

questions.q: What is a characteristic of a SOHO network?
o: connects each switch to every other switch in the network
enables multiple users to share a single broadband connection
provides high throughput access for 1000 or more users
includes at least three tiers of devices to provide load balancing and redundancy
questions.e: A SOHO (Small Office/Home Office) network typically focuses on basic connectivity, enabling multiple users to share a single broadband connection.

questions.q: Which state does the switch port move to when PortFast is enabled?
questions.e: PortFast causes the switch port to move immediately to the **forwarding** state, skipping the listening and learning states.

questions.q: When PC-A sends traffic to PC-B, which network component is in charge of receiving the packet from PC-A, verifying the IP addresses, and forwarding the packet to PC-B?
questions.e: Since PC-A (10.10.10.0/24) and PC-B (10.10.100.0/24) are on different subnets, a **Router** is required to route traffic between them at Layer 3.

questions.q: What are two roles of the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)? (Choose two)
o: The DHCP server offers the ability to exclude specific IP addresses from a pool of IP addresses
The DHCP client can request up to four DNS server addresses
The DHCP server assigns IP addresses without requiring the client to renew them
The DHCP server leases client IP addresses dynamically.
The DHCP client maintains a pool of IP addresses it can assign.
questions.e: DHCP servers dynamically **lease** IP addresses (D) and allow administrators to **exclude** specific IP addresses from the available pool (A).

questions.q: What is the purpose of NAT (Network Address Translation) in networking?
o: To map private IP addresses to public IP addresses
To establish secure connections between devices
questions.e: NAT's primary role is to translate non-routable private IP addresses used internally into routable public IP addresses for external communication.

questions.q: Which command set establishes failover redundancy if the primary circuit goes down?
questions.e: To configure failover redundancy, a **floating static route** must be used. This involves defining a second default route (`0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0`) with a higher Administrative Distance (AD), such as '2', so it is only used if the primary route (AD 1) fails.

questions.q: What is the role of a firewall in an enterprise network?
o: Forwards packets based on stateless packet inspection
Processes unauthorized packets and allows passage to less secure segments of the network
determines which packets are allowed to cross from unsecured to secured networks
explicitly denies all packets from entering an administrative domain
questions.e: The primary role of a firewall is to enforce security policy by controlling and determining which packets are permitted to cross between networks, such as between the internet (unsecured) and the internal network (secured).

questions.q: Which output displays a JSON data representation?
questions.e: Valid JSON uses colons (:) to separate keys and values and commas (,) to separate elements within an object or array. Option D is the only syntactically correct JSON representation.

questions.q: What does ACL stand for?
questions.e: ACL stands for Access Control List, which is used to filter network traffic based on specified criteria.

questions.q: Which command enables IPv6 routing on a Cisco router?
questions.e: The ipv6 unicast-routing command enables IPv6 routing capabilities on a Cisco router.

questions.q: What is the default violation mode for port security on a Cisco switch?
questions.e: The default violation mode for port security is shutdown, which puts the port in error-disabled state when a violation occurs.

questions.q: Which server is required for WPA2 Enterprise authentication?
questions.e: RADIUS server is required for WPA2 Enterprise authentication to handle user authentication.

questions.q: What is the administrative distance of OSPF?
questions.e: OSPF has an administrative distance of 110, making it more preferred than RIP (120) but less than EIGRP (90).

questions.q: Which protocol defines port-based authentication for LAN access?
questions.e: 802.1x is the IEEE standard that defines port-based network access control.

questions.q: What is the purpose of NAT?
questions.e: NAT (Network Address Translation) translates private IP addresses to public IP addresses for internet communication.

questions.q: Which command allows only SSH access on a router?
questions.e: The command 'transport input ssh' allows only SSH access and disables other methods like Telnet.

questions.q: What is the default queuing method on Cisco routers?
questions.e: FIFO (First-In-First-Out) is the default queuing method where packets are sent in the order they arrive.

questions.q: Which 802.11 standards operate in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands?
questions.e: 802.11n and 802.11ac operate in both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequency bands.

questions.q: What is the purpose of the 'ip helper-address' command?
questions.e: The ip helper-address command forwards DHCP requests from clients to a remote DHCP server.

questions.q: Which term describes a backup route with higher administrative distance?
questions.e: A floating static route is configured with higher administrative distance to serve as a backup route.

questions.q: What is the IPv6 prefix for unique local addresses?
questions.e: FD00::/8 is the prefix for IPv6 unique local addresses (ULAs) used for local communications.

questions.q: Which command displays DHCP bindings on a Cisco router?
questions.e: The 'show ip dhcp binding' command displays DHCP lease information including IP addresses and MAC addresses.

questions.q: What is the purpose of STP in a switched network?
questions.e: STP (Spanning Tree Protocol) prevents loops in switched networks by creating a loop-free topology.

subnetting.q: What subnet mask allows 30 usable hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: /27 mask provides 32 addresses total, with 30 usable for hosts

subnetting.q: Given 192.168.1.0/26, what is the broadcast address?
subnetting.e: /26 gives subnets of 64 addresses: 0-63, 64-127, etc. First broadcast is 192.168.1.63

subnetting.q: How many subnets can be created from 10.0.0.0/18?
subnetting.e: Borrowing 10 bits from host portion: 2^10 = 1,024 subnets (but Class A starts with /8, so /18 means 10 bits borrowed)

subnetting.q: What mask creates exactly 2 usable hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: /30 mask provides 4 addresses total, with 2 usable for hosts

subnetting.q: Given 172.16.25.100/22, what is the network address?
subnetting.e: /22 means 4 host bits borrowed. 172.16.24.0 to 172.16.27.255 range

subnetting.q: What is the broadcast address for 192.168.2.60/28?
subnetting.e: /28 creates subnets of 16 addresses. 192.168.2.48-63, so broadcast is .63

subnetting.q: How many usable hosts with mask 255.255.252.0?
What subnet mask for 500 hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: Need 512 total addresses (510 usable), so /23 mask

subnetting.q: Given 210.30.12.0/26, what are the broadcast addresses?
subnetting.e: /26 creates subnets of 64 addresses each, broadcast is last address in each subnet

subnetting.q: How many bits borrowed for mask 255.255.240.0?
subnetting.e: 240 in binary is 11110000, so 4 bits are borrowed from host portion

subnetting.q: What is the first usable IP in subnet 172.16.32.0/19?
subnetting.e: First usable IP is always network address + 1

subnetting.q: How many usable IPs with mask 255.255.255.240?
subnetting.e: /28 mask provides 16 total addresses, minus 2 for network and broadcast

subnetting.q: What subnet mask for exactly 4 subnets from 192.168.20.0/24?
subnetting.e: Need 2 bits for 4 subnets: 2^2 = 4, so /26 mask

subnetting.q: Given 10.10.0.0/16, what mask for 1000 hosts per subnet?
subnetting.e: Need 1024 total addresses (1022 usable), so /22 mask

labs.name: Fix DHCP
labs.scenario: PC not getting IP. Fix DHCP on R1.

labs.name: Configure OSPF
labs.scenario: Router cannot reach remote networks. Configure OSPF routing.
labs.feedback: OSPF neighbors formed, routing table updated!

labs.name: Enable Port Security
labs.scenario: Unauthorized device connected to switch port. Enable port security.
labs.solution:
switchport port-security
switchport port-security maximum 1
switchport port-security violation shutdown
labs.feedback: Port security enabled, unauthorized access blocked!

labs.name: Configure Static Route
labs.scenario: Router cannot reach 10.0.0.0/24 network. Add static route.

labs.name: Enable IPv6 Routing
labs.scenario: Router not forwarding IPv6 traffic. Enable IPv6 capabilities.
labs.feedback: IPv6 routing enabled, IPv6 traffic flowing!

labs.name: Configure Access List
labs.scenario: Block HTTP traffic from 192.168.1.0/24 to web server.
labs.solution:
access-list 101 deny tcp 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.255 any eq 80
access-list 101 permit ip any any
labs.feedback: HTTP traffic blocked, other traffic allowed!

labs.name: Configure VLAN Trunk
labs.scenario: Switch ports need to carry multiple VLANs. Configure trunk port.
labs.solution:
switchport mode trunk
switchport trunk allowed vlan all
labs.feedback: Trunk configured, multiple VLANs can traverse the link!

labs.name: Set Up NAT Overload
labs.scenario: Configure PAT to allow multiple internal hosts to share one public IP.
labs.solution:
access-list 1 permit 192.168.1.0 0.0.0.255
ip nat inside source list 1 interface gigabitethernet0/0 overload
labs.feedback: NAT overload configured, multiple hosts can access internet!

labs.name: Configure SSH Access
labs.scenario: Insecure Telnet access enabled. Configure secure SSH access only.
labs.solution:
ip domain-name example.com
crypto key generate rsa
username admin privilege 15 password cisco
line vty 0 15
transport input ssh
login local
labs.feedback: SSH configured, secure remote access enabled!

labs.name: Enable EIGRP Routing
labs.scenario: Configure EIGRP for autonomous system 100 on the router.
